content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good problem with fair difficulty level w.r.t to COC

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very nice exercise, it was very funny challenge !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This exercise is quite easy to complete, the cases are clear and it can be done quickly in reverse, short or fast mode.

In order not to repeat my other message I edited this one.

The only thing you should confirm is that there is no exercise like this on the platform.

My solution:
column = input()
n = int(input())
index = input().split(',').index(column)
values = [input().split(',')[index] for _ in range(n-1)]
print(sorted(values,key=lambda x: values.count(x))[-1])

Thanks!
I am not a big fan of short mode, as I was prefer code readability and maintainability, hence I did not propose this option.
